intro: Trigonia eriosperma subsp. eriosperma, commonly known as the woolly triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds with a tuft of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
